item.title: R and Python Talk
item.description: # R code chunk library(reticulate) wc<-"Welcome" # Phython code chunk tb="to the blog" print(r.wc,tb) ## ('Welcome', 'to the blog') cat(c(wc,py$tb)) ## Welcome to the blog

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: Modeling Instructions A knitted R Markdown document (as a PDF) and the raw R Markdown file (as .Rmd) should both be submitted to Canvas by 11:59pm on 5/1/2020. These two documents will be graded jointly, so they must be consistent (i.e., don’t change the R Markdown file without also updating the knitted document). Knit an html copy too, for later! In the .Rmd file for Project 2, you can copy the first code-chunk into your project .

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Data Wrangling and Data Exploration Introduction: Two real-life datasets found for this project aim to illustrate whether there is a relation between life expentency and happiness level of the countries around the world. Both datasets are acquired from https://wwww.kaggle.com/datasets, and they interest me in the same way that they are comparing aspects of human on a world scale. The first dataset named “Happy” is organized as a World Happiness Report of 2019.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are two projects I have completed from computational biology class: Exploratory Data Analysis with Tidyverse Tools Modeling, Testing, and Classification
